programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Lita McClinton thinks the man at her door is just delivering a dozen pink roses, but the delivery guy delivers death instead; the decades-long hunt for justice spans multiple continents before reaching a dramatic conclusion in an Atlanta courtroom.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When the body of 22-year-old Misty Morse is found floating in the Indian River, police suspect one of her many boyfriends; with only a piece of nautical rope and a strip of duct tape to go on, an unusual kind of DNA could actually break the case.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Small-town plumber John Cataneo fixes other people's homes for a living, until death came knocking on his front door; to find out who wanted him dead, police investigate the contents of Cataneo's own home, and get the leak they need.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Buffalo Bills rally from a 21-point deficit to beat the New England Patriots 35-31, to stay alive in the AFC East's playoff race.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Colts rally behind Daniel Jones three touchdown performance as they attempt to overcome a Jacoby Brissett led Cardinals squad in a back-and-forth battle.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Michael Penix proved worthy of that belief in Atlanta's 34-27 win over the short-handed Washington Commanders on Sunday. He threw for a career-high 313 yards, completing 20 of 26 passes with two touchdowns and one interception, and directed the Falcons to a season-high 435 yards of offense.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Christian Benford intercepted Joe Burrow's toss and returned it 63 yards for a go-ahead touchdown with 5:25 left, Josh Allen threw for 3 touchdowns and ran in another, and the Buffalo Bills beat the Cincinnati Bengals 39-34 on a snowy Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Joe Flacco passed for 342 yards and three touchdowns as he rallied Cincinnati to a 33-31 victory over the Pittsburgh Steelers as the third time during the regular season where both starting quarterbacks are in their 40s.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Tony Pollard rushed for a career-high 161 yards and two touchdowns as Tennessee averaged 5.3 yards per carry. The defense forced a pair of turnovers in the second half and the special teams blocked a punt.

programme.title: NFL Media Originals
programme.desc: Best moments from the top 15 games of the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Baker Mayfield and the Buccaneers battle with Sam Darnold and the Seahawks in a back-and-forth shootout that features an elite wide receiver matchup between Emeka Egbuka and Jaxon Smith-Njigba in a game that comes down to the wire.

programme.title: NFL Game of the Week
programme.desc: New York Jets running back Breece Hall rushed for 2 second-half touchdowns and threw a 4-yard touchdown pass to Mason Taylor with 1:54 left, helping Justin Fields and the Jets edge the Cincinnati Bengals 39-38 on Sunday for their first win.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: In a stirring battle between 2 rookie quarterbacks, Pick No. 40 came out on top of Pick No. 1 as the New Orleans Saints rallied to beat the Tennessee Titans 34-26 on Sunday at Nissan Stadium in Nashville.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Three of NASCARs Rising stars are thrown into the fire as they take on the most famous and dangerous track in America - Daytona to kick off the season. Go deep inside the lives of Rajah Caruth, Jesse Love, and Carson Hocevar as they prepare for the biggest race of the season. Who will triumph and who will crash and burn?

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After his disastrous day at Daytona, Carson Hocevar changes his tune and dazzles the NASCAR world with his aggression in Atlanta. Learn more about where Rajah Caruth comes from as well as his philosophy on the peaks and valleys of a NASCAR season. Jesse Love prepares for his NASCAR cup debut on the golf course with fellow driver Connor Zilisch.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Relive three of the most impactful weeks in Carson Hocevars life, where he had a shot to win three races in a row.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After a dreary start to the season, Rajah Caruth claims his second career win in Nashville. Jesse Love relives the most challenging years of his life before returning to his home track in Sonoma. Amidst the August heat in Daytona Beach, Carson Hocevar has one last shot to prove hes a playoff driver.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: A full recap of the playoff run of both Rajah Caruth and Jesse Love - which results in a spectacularly dramatic race in Phoenix.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.desc: At Halloween, rustlers take advantage of the seasonal disguises to raid a cattle ranch. Lucas' faith in his son's honesty is shaken when he hears rumors of Mark being mixed up with the thieves.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark and Lucas run into Micah on the trail and help when the prisoner he is transporting injures his arm. Lucas' life is endangered when a snake crawls into his bed.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is baffled when the marshal of a neighboring town refuses to hold a gambler who just attempted murder.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark is injured in an accident, leaving his legs paralyzed. At the doctor's suggestion, Lucas and Mark set out on a trek to Mission Springs.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is on his way to River City to transport three convicts there to be hanged. The dangerous prisoners escape and appoint themselves the law, after the town is hit by a tornado, killing the sheriff.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A journalist accompanies Josh on his manhunt to get an exclusive story on a bounty hunter. Josh agrees to let him join him in the hunt for Jack Torrance but finds they have different methods.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is sent for by the desperate men of Coronado. He is hired to convince the women of the town to come back to their men when they leave demanding that all towns men give up their guns for good.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.desc: Country singer Jessie Lee Harris pays a visit to Baywatch in search of his estranged wife and son.

programme.desc: Matt and Summer volunteer their time when cutbacks put the Baywatch lifeguards jobs in jeopardy.

programme.desc: Stephanie spends a week with the Coast Guard to help them crack a dangerous arms smuggling ring.

programme.desc: Matt doesn't know whose story to believe when he tries to reunite a runaway teen and her father.

programme.desc: A Hollywood producer desperate for a new TV series idea observes a Baywatch rescue.

programme.desc: After the earthquake which almost took his life, Hobie leaves California to live with his mother.

programme.desc: John Cort shows up at headquarters and convinces Mitch to compete in a dune buggy race.

programme.desc: Mitch has to work a 24-hour shift with Stephanie and Hobie is pressured into throwing a house party.

programme.desc: Mitch helps a woman he calls The Mermaid who turns out to be the wife of a crime boss.

programme.title: Jasper Redd: Jazz Talk

programme.title: Moshe Kasher: Live in Oakland
programme.desc: Back on his home turf Oakland-bred comic and best-selling author, Moshe Kasher, finds comedy in uproarious stories about the people he's met and how they see him.

programme.title: Sid Davis: Baggage Claim
programme.desc: Former airline worker Sid Davis unloads side-splitting baggage, with humor fueled by ADD and a teacher wife who views him as a child left behind.

programme.title: Samsons World Vol 3 (Edited Version)
programme.desc: Samson Crouppen opens up his house for your viewing pleasure.

programme.title: Samsons World Vol 4
programme.desc: Samson Crouppen opens up his house for your viewing pleasure.

programme.title: Pete Correale: The Things We Do for Love
programme.desc: The comic, named one of Entertainment Weeklys top ten to watch, who has dazzled on "The Tonight Show," "The Late Show," and more, shines once again.

programme.title: Pete Correale: Let Me Tell Ya
programme.desc: The absurdities of life, marriage, love, and the hard task of men doing their own pedicures are some of the hilarious observations in this live set.

programme.title: Subhah Agarwal: Airport Pigeon
programme.desc: Veteran stand-up comedian Subhah Agarwal has the audience in stitches while getting personal in this special centered around mental health.

programme.title: Leanne Morgan: So Yummy
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses dogs, cheerleading camp, the struggles of being an empty nester, and joining Weight Watchers for the 7th time.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: I Could Eat - Part 1
programme.desc: Lavell Crawford is back and here to contemplate how "My 600 Pound Life" could go for 15 seasons and he was still underweight, the kind of racist you have to be to not take a free holiday, and explosive consequences in a Taco Bell bathroom.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford I Could Eat Part 2
programme.desc: Meat's on the menu with Lavell Crawford keeping Burger King humble to their have it your way slogan, godless vegetarians, and why the best chicken is from a house of God.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Achmed Saves America
programme.desc: The world's most incompetent terrorist finds himself whisked away from his homeland and taken to Americaville, USA.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquists dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, Jos Jalapeo, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Controlled Chaos
programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Minding the Monsters
programme.desc: The comedian and ventriloquist extraordinaire, along with this felt friends, visits a haunted house where hilarious chaos ensues.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Spark of Insanity
programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: Previously unseen stand-up comedy by Jeff Dunham; sketches that include popular characters; Brad Paisley performs; special appearances by comic Chris Parnell and former UFC champion Chuck Liddell.

programme.title: Paul Reiser: Life, Death & Rice Pudding
programme.desc: Paul Reiser discusses downsizing, marriage and rice pudding in his first stand-up special in more than 30 years.

programme.title: Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Fran Drescher leads a cast of mature women of stand-up in a night of uninhibited comedy; featuring Carole Montgomery, Luenell, Lynne Koplitz, Kerri Louise and Vanessa Hollingshead.

programme.title: Russell Peters: Deported
programme.desc: The hilarious Russell Peters performs at a stadium in Mumbai where he laments gaining weight, spoofs Bollywood vocals, and talks about being a dad.

programme.title: Stand Up for the Pits Comedy Special with Rebecca Corry Hosted by Kayley Cuoco
programme.desc: The Stand Up For Pits Foundation is a nonprofit dedicated to educating, advocating and saving the lives of pit bull "type" dogs.

programme.title: Dwayne Perkins: Take Note
programme.desc: In his debut special, Brooklyn comic Dwayne Perkins breaks down America's place in the world, the difference between sports and activities and more.

programme.title: Dwayne Perkins: Please Believe It
programme.desc: The stand up comedian shares his honest takes on inspirational stories, traveling all around the world, and getting over adults riding bicycles.

programme.title: Dwayne Perkins: Dwayne Explains
programme.desc: The talented comedian talks about what his friend did that almost made him miss his own special, and what gets him up in the morning.

programme.title: Bryan Callen: Man Class
programme.desc: In his first one-hour comedy special, the former MADtv comic gives his unique take on how to be a real man in our ever-changing modern society.

programme.title: Bryan Callen: Never Grow Up
programme.desc: The comedian examines the way our modern culture works, and wonders why we feel the need to view each other in such a narrow box.

programme.title: Aries Spears: Comedy Blueprint
programme.desc: The MADTV alum takes the stage in Philadelphia to deliver jokes and impressions, where no one is spared from his ferociously aggressive comic style.

programme.title: Andy Sandford: Shameful Information
programme.desc: This New York comic uses his first hour special to tackle only the important issues: burrito privacy, farting on airplanes, and McDonalds mix-ups.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: I Can Laugh About It Now
programme.desc: The comedian discusses his lifes difficulties including addiction, bankruptcy, and how to overcome tragedy by making lemonade out of lemons.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: Honor Thy Wife
programme.desc: The laugh-out-loud funny stand up comedian focuses his special on the hilarious highs and relatable lows of everyday married life.

programme.title: Katrina Davis: Figuring It Out
programme.desc: Join comedian Katrina Davis as she shares her observations about coffee shop hygiene and the freedom that comes with discovering your dumbest self.

programme.title: Loni Love: America's Sister
programme.desc: Don't get uppity with outrageous comedian Loni Love as she breaks down athletes who gain weight, racial sensibilities, celebrity deaths and more.

programme.title: Sasheer Zamata: Pizza Mind
programme.desc: Sasheer Zamatas "Pizza Mind" will give viewers food for thought. In this all-new stand-up special, Sasheer covers a spectrum of topics, from drugs to relationships, Disney racism to politics _ nothing is off limits. This multi-talented comedian incorporates different performance elements to express her opinions and dive into her personal life, truly giving you a piece of her mind.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When an infant dies under mysterious circumstances, the young parents are prime suspects. Dr. G discovers several clues that bolster the child abuse theory, but the case is not clear cut.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame in a man's death or if there was a silent killer lurking in his body.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A daughter wants to surprise her dad with breakfast in bed but finds him unresponsive. His family is convinced they know what killed him, but Dr. G must let the evidence speak for itself.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.desc: Dr. G has a challenge on her hands: a victim's body spent days decaying before it was found, and decomposition could get in the way of her investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hiker stumbles across a man's dead body in the woods. The victim's brother is convinced he was murdered. Dr. G must get to the bottom of this case. Was foul play really involved?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. Farley discusses the bizarre case of a pregnant mother who suddenly dies. As the autopsy unfolds, Dr. Farley uncovers information that could have saved her and her unborn child's life.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hotel clerk calls 9-1-1 complaining of severe facial trauma, but he has no recollection of what happened and dies soon after. Police are counting on Dr. G to aid them in this investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Keith Douglas is met with a barrage of bullets as he opens his door. The police are looking to Dr. G for hard evidence to link certain suspects to the murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After driving to his parent's house, Cameron Walker finds his dad dead in bed, and his mom bound in the closet.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An otherwise healthy child had been complaining of stomach pains. Could the medicine his mother had recently given him be to blame? Or could his death be from something more sinister?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young boy at a sleepover party mysteriously loses control of his arms and legs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient with a headache begins seizing, a wrestler has been vomiting for five days and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teen is bleeding internally from an ectopic pregnancy but denies ever having had sex.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman's pregnancy veers toward tragedy as eclampsia threatens both her life and that of her child.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A Halloween zombie with a problem below the belt mystifies doctors.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A deranged cowboy is drenched in sweat, saliva and urine. No one knows why.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Treatment of a young boy's broken leg turns into an investigation that may reveal child abuse.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient can't remember the past 20 years and her doctor desperately needs to know what she's forgotten.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A knifing victim suddenly starts seizing and his doctors can't treat him until they figure out the cause.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A mountain biker has multiple injuries and her boyfriend has multiple fainting spells.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A night on the town quickly turns into a fiasco in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A paralyzed stroke patient watches in horror as his wife and his two girlfriends fight over him.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A dialysis patient is bleeding and doctors can't get it to stop. A naked man falls onto a cactus.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER doctor's friend arrives at the hospital combative and out of control, attacking the doctor in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man comes in apparently clawed by a tiger, a patient says he's been shot in the head and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's leg pain turns out to be flesh-eating virus, threatening life and limb; a Desert Storm war veteran swallows razor blades on a dare; a bride-to-be spends her wedding day in the ER after collapsing at the altar.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: This special episodes features ten of the craziest stories from the first 100 episodes.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, a burn victim receives a rare treatment the doctors have never performed before.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: The hospital is locked down when a nurse is shot in the ER. A bride is rushed in from her wedding.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman gets stuck in a toilet bowl; a man's leg is mangled by a stump grinder; a nurse collapses.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman risks losing her finger after trying on an engagement ring, a body builder can't breathe and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Nursing Intuition
programme.desc: A stroke patient's heart mysteriously stops, starts again and then stops.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A snake bite victim may die in the ER because life-saving anti-venom is in short supply.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A bride can't go through with her wedding because she feels possessed by creatures crawling in her head.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pianist's finger is accidentally sawed off, a man's pacemaker is killing him yet keeping him alive and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's leg pain turns out to be a flesh-eating virus, threatening life and limb.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two car crash victims, a man and a woman, arrive separately and nearly naked.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A knifing victim suddenly starts seizing and his doctors can't treat him until they figure out the cause.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: When a man with a hand injury passes out from abdominal pain, tests lead to a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young boy at a sleepover party mysteriously loses control of his arms and legs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: From extraordinary challenges to outrageous predicaments, nurses tell true medical stories from their unique perspectives.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two skydivers are rushed in, a bride-to-be gets her finger stuck in a make-up jar and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Celebrations morph into medical mania after their special occasions land them in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man's head is impaled by a trophy deer's antlers, a nurse's ex brings his new girlfriend to the ER and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young nurse collapses in the ER and her co-workers must restart her heart.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An alligator snapping turtle is clamped to a man's neck and won't let go, a hurricane is impending and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A grown man suddenly begins acting bizarrely like a child, a wheezing woman has a breathing problem and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A hospital worker feels like she's dying but doctors can find nothing wrong.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two patients arrive at the ER with bizarre fishing injuries; a martial arts instructor suffers abdominal pains; teenage victims of a car crash fill a small ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A surgeon requires urgent treatment after falling off a bed while trying to help his patient.

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: Contestants on this dating game show don't want to hear the elimination line "I'm sorry, but you have too much baggage." How much is acceptable among three contestants in each episode is determined by the "dater," who hears the candidates' intimate secrets and hidden flaws, as well as their attempts to deflect these traits by describing their positive attributes. After two elimination rounds leave one remaining contestant, it's the dater's turn to reveal his or her own baggage ... and then the contestant decides to go forward with the date or not. Jerry Springer hosts.

Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.desc: This is the fifth week of the TV Show and none of the participants have been able to cross the Big Balls.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns dont come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of violent love, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about plants for free at Longmeadow this week as Monty adds self-sown ornamental grass seedlings to the paradise garden. He also divides ferns for planting elsewhere in the garden. Advolly Richmond explores the history of lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: For many gardeners, the beginning of September is the start of a new season. Monty Don embraces this shift as he harvests an abundance of delicious produce, at the same time as looking ahead to the spring.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don adds some foxtail lilies to his dry garden, Carol Klein visits salvia expert William Dyson in Kent, and we meet a remarkable woman from a family of gardeners on the eve of her 100th birthday.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don cuts back his wildflower meadow and, with an eye on some early season colour next year, makes a start on planting up his spring containers. Joe Swift learns the importance of allotment bee keeping when he visits a plot in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As well as catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow, Monty Don meets world-renowned garden designer, Piet Oudolf, at his latest creation in Somerset. He gets to grips with Oudolf's iconic naturalistic planting and explains how we can adapt this style to our very own gardens. Meanwhile, Carol Klein goes tree climbing in Bristol to find out how important these precious havens are for urban wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the arrival of October, it is time to start thinking about getting some onions and garlic in the ground, and Monty Don shares his secrets on how to get a successful crop. Elsewhere, Carol Klein takes first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for a day out in Devon. They are on the hunt for some seasonal inspiration for their new garden and what better place to look than RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow sharing a wealth of tips and ideas on how to keep your garden looking good all year long. He tackles some urgent pruning, and reveals some of the projects he's got in store over the coming months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.
